instruction: Patient has had a persistent cough for close to six weeks, mostly dry with occasional phlegm in the morning, no blood in sputum, no fever, chills, or night sweats. Patient experiences slight shortness of breath when climbing stairs. No history of asthma. Partner smokes outside. Recent increase in heartburn.

attributes.narrative: Patient has had a persistent cough for close to six weeks, mostly dry with occasional phlegm in the morning. No blood in sputum, no fever, chills, or night sweats. Patient experiences slight shortness of breath when climbing stairs. No history of asthma. Partner smokes outside. Recent increase in heartburn.

instruction: Medication for reflux to see if it helps with the cough.

attributes.sig: Take 1 capsule by mouth once daily, preferably before a meal, to help manage reflux and potentially alleviate cough.
attributes.note_to_pharmacist: Dispense 30 capsules for a 30-day supply. Ensure the patient is not allergic to any excipients in the formulation.
